bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Editor of the Army Register, September 22, 1937

div1.p: Hench requests a copy of the 1937 Army Roll of Honor and the addresses of surviving participants in the yellow fever experiments.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Editor of the Army Register, September 22, 1937
div1.opener:
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
September 22, 1937
Editor of the Army Register
War Department
Washington, D. C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Will it be possible for me to obtain
a copy of the “Roll of Honor” from the Army Register
for 1937, or if this is not possible, that for 1936?
I am preparing an article for presentation to the
staff of the Mayo Clinic on the yellow fever investiga-
tion in Cuba, and am anxious to get the details concern-
ing the various participants, as published in the “Roll
of Honor” of the Army Register. A copy of the Register
for 1936 has been loaned to me, and I am anxious to
have one for myself. The 1936 Register, pages 1417 to
1419, gives the details of these events.

Can you tell me the present addresses
of those who have survived? I should appreciate this
very much indeed.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
12 Received A. G. O. SEP 27, 1937
